author: jianyunt
body:
get-command  'a particular commandlet' is  expected to return a single object. But `get-command ?` returns %, h, r, and ? - unexpected.  The behavior breaks our telemetry code.

``` PowerShell
PS C:\users> get-command ?

CommandType     Name                                               Version    Source
-----------     ----                                               -------    ------
Alias           % -> ForEach-Object
Alias           ? -> Where-Object
Alias           h -> Get-History
Alias           r -> Invoke-History


PS C:\users> get-command h

CommandType     Name                                               Version    Source
-----------     ----                                               -------    ------
Alias           h -> Get-History

```
<!--

If it is a bug report:

You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases

- Refer to the [known issues](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template:

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell

```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```none

```

Actual behavior
---------------

```none

```

Environment data
----------------
PowerShell 5.1 or core
PS C:\users> $psversiontable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.14393
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0


```powershell
> $PSVersionTable

```

comments.author: stknohg
comments.body:
The same issue occurs when using `Get-Help` or `-?` parameter.

```powershell
Get-Help -Name ?

? -?
```

These commands are expected to be same as `Get-Help -Name Where-Object`(`Where-Object -?`), but actually it is not.

```powershell
# PowerShell Core 6.0.1
PS C:\> Get-Help -Name Where-Object

NAME
    Where-Object

SYNTAX
    Where-Object [-Property] <string> [[-Value] <Object>] [-InputObject <psobject>] [-EQ]  [<CommonParameters>]
...

PS C:\> Where-Object -?

NAME
    Where-Object

SYNTAX
    Where-Object [-Property] <string> [[-Value] <Object>] [-InputObject <psobject>] [-EQ]  [<CommonParameters>]
...

```

```powershell
# PowerShell Core 6.0.1
PS C:\> Get-Help -Name ?

Name                              Category  Module                    Synopsis
----                              --------  ------                    --------
%                                 Alias                               ForEach-Object
?                                 Alias                               Where-Object
h                                 Alias                               Get-History
r                                 Alias                               Invoke-History

PS C:\> ? -?

Name                              Category  Module                    Synopsis
----                              --------  ------                    --------
%                                 Alias                               ForEach-Object
?                                 Alias                               Where-Object
h                                 Alias                               Get-History
r                                 Alias                               Invoke-History
```

The root cause is that there is no way to escape wildcard characters in `Get-Command`, `Get-Help`.

comments.author: stknohg
comments.body:
@iSazonov Thank you. but...

```powershell
# Wildcard character is escaped, command returns expected result.
PS C:\> Get-Command -Name '`?'

CommandType     Name                                               Version    Source
-----------     ----                                               -------    ------
Alias           ? -> Where-Object
```

```powershell
# Wildcard character is escaped, command returns expected result?
PS C:\> Get-Help -Name '`?'


Name          : ?
Category      : Alias
Synopsis      : Where-Object
Component     :
Role          :
Functionality :
```

`-?` parameter is still left.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT Is it still a problem with telemetry?

title: What to expect while running Get-Command '?'
